page.title: 01Warsop: A General View.
page.content: Our block can be divided into 3 main sections according to land use. Settlement is mainly in the west of the area, largely in the triangle formed by the junction of the 2 mineral railways and the River Meden. Warsop is an old settlement sited originally around the church but developed onto the south eastern slopes of the river to avoid flooding. Although originally a farming village, it is now a combination of farming, mining and residential areas. It has a population of over 15,000. The main routes of communication are the A6O road running north-south and the B6035 running east-west. The eastern part of the block is mainly agricultural land under crops and coniferous woodland which is part of Sherwood Forest. The forest makes our block more picturesque.
